member.name: T:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure
member.summary: Specifies the unit of measure for the given data.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Point
member.summary: (0) Specifies a printer's point (1/72 inch) as the unit of measure. These are default units used in PDF documents.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Inch
member.summary: (1) Specifies the inch as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Millimeter
member.summary: (2) Specifies the millimeter as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Centimeter
member.summary: (3) Specifies the centimeter as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Pixel96DPI
member.summary: (4) Specifies a device pixel at 96 DPI resolution as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Pixel120DPI
member.summary: (5) Specifies a device pixel at 120 DPI resolution as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Twip
member.summary: (6) Specifies the Twip unit (1/20 inch) as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.UnitOfMeasure.Document
member.summary: (7) Specifies the document unit (1/300 inch) as the unit of measure.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineCaptionType.Inline
member.summary: Indicates Inline as annotations caption positioning.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineCaptionType.Top
member.summary: Indicates Top as annotations caption positioning.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.Square
member.summary: A square.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.Circle
member.summary: A circle.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.Diamond
member.summary: A diamond shape.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.OpenArrow
member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.ClosedArrow
member.summary: Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the Bytescout.PDF.PDFLineEndingStyle.OpenArrow style and connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.None
member.summary: No line ending.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.Butt
member.summary: A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.ROpenArrow
member.summary: Two short lines in the reverse direction from Bytescout.PDF.PDFLineEndingStyle.OpenArrow.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.RClosedArrow
member.summary: A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from Bytescout.PDF.PDFLineEndingStyle.ClosedArrow.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDF.LineEndingStyle.Slash
member.summary: A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself.

member.name: T:LibTiff.Classic.TiffTag
member.summary: TIFF tag definitions.
member.remarks:
Joris Van Damme maintains
TIFF Tag Reference, good source of tag information. It's an overview of known TIFF Tags with properties, short description, and other useful information.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorEditType
member.summary:
This simple type specifies all possible settings for how DrawingML contents shall be resized when the rows and columns between its start and ending anchor (the from and to child elements) are resized, or have additional rows/columns inserted within them.
Please take a look at: Open XML spec, 20.5.3.2 ST_EditAs simple type

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorEditType.absolute
member.summary: Do Not Move or Resize With Underlying Rows/Columns

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorEditType.oneCell
member.summary: Move With Cells but Do Not Resize

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.AnchorEditType.twoCell
member.summary: Move and Resize With Anchor Cells

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.SheetState
member.summary: This simple type defines the possible states for sheet visibility. Please take a look at: Open XML spec, 18.18.68 ST_SheetState (Sheet Visibility Types)

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.SheetState.hidden
member.summary: Indicates the workbook window is hidden, but can be shown by the user via the user interface.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.SheetState.veryHidden
member.summary: Indicates the sheet is hidden and cannot be shown in the user interface (UI). This state is only available programmatically.

member.name: F:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.SheetState.visible
member.summary: Indicates the sheet is visible.

member.name: T:Bytescout.Spreadsheet.OpenXML.Types.VerticalAlignRun
member.summary:
Vertical position of the text relative to the text's default appearance.
Please take a look at: Open XML spec, 18.4.14 vertAlign (Vertical Alignment)

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseExtractor.CheckPermissions
member.summary: This option defines if the SDK should check permissions in the PDF and generate PDFExtractorPermissionsException when permissions is not set for the desired action Set to True by default. You should not change it to another value. member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.PageDataCaching
member.summary: Page data caching behaviour.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.PageDataCaching.None
member.summary: Previously accessed page data is not cached and disposed immediately after any other page accessed. Reduces memory usage.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.PageDataCaching.KeepAllPages
member.summary: Caches all parsed pages. You can manually dispose cached pages using method.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode
member.summary: OCR (Optical Character Recognition) usage mode.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.Off
member.summary: Off. No OCR is used.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.Auto
member.summary: Similar to TextFromImagesAndVectorsAndFonts but checks if the page contains raster images and vector drawings only to decide if should use OCR functionality. Runs OCR if page contains almost no text and have 1 or more images / vector drawings so tries to extract text from images and drawings The result contains text objects produced from images and vector drawings using OCR functionality if any.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndVectorsAndFonts
member.summary: Always runs OCR to extract text from images and vector drawings (if any). See also .TextFromImagesAndFonts mode to read from objects except vector drawings. The result contains text objects from PDF and text objects produced from images and vector drawings using OCR functionality if any.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndVectorsAndRepairedFonts
member.summary: Special mode: extracts text from images and vector drawings and repairs text from fonts fixing the incorrect encoding. Some PDF files contain visible text which is damaged when copied (appears as ? or other incorrect symbols when extracted or copied). This mode repairs damaged text like that using the OCR functionality. The result contains text objects from PDF and text objects produced from images and vector drawings using OCR functionality if any.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromRepairedFontsOnly
member.summary: Special mode: repairs text objects with incorrect encoding using OCR functionality. Images and vectors are not processed in this mode. Some PDF files contains visible text which is damaged when copied (appears as ? or other incorrect symbols when extracted or copied). This mode repairs damaged text like this using OCR function. This mode returns repaired text objects only (no images or vector drawings are processed).

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndRepairedFonts
member.summary: Special mode: extracts text from raster images (but skips vector drawings) and repairs text objects with incorrect encoding Some PDF files contains visible text which is damaged when copied (appears as ? or other incorrect symbols when extracted or copied). This mode repairs damaged text like this using the OCR functionality. This mode returns repaired text objects and text objects produced from raster images (no vector drawings are processed).

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndFonts
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from images (but skips vector drawings) plus the text objects. The result contains text objects from PDF and text objects produced from images (but no vector drawings are processed) using OCR functionality.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesOnly
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from images (but skips vector drawings) plus the text objects. The result contains text extracted from images only.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromVectorsOnly
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from vector drawings only. The result contains text objects from vector drawings only.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRMode.TextFromImagesAndVectorsOnly
member.summary: Runs OCR to extract text from images and vector drawings only. no text from pdf objects is included. The result contains text objects from vector drawings only.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode
member.summary: Sets if lines are not checked to be merged, can be merged by rows, or inside columns

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.None
member.summary: No lines grouping. Each line is processed as a single row.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.GroupByRows
member.summary: Each row is checked against next row to see if these rows can be grouped. Rows are grouped only if all cells in the current row are allowed to be grouped with all cells in next row.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.LineGroupingMode.GroupByColumns
member.summary: Each cell is checked against cell below in next row to see if the can be grouped. Cells are be grouped inside the same column even if cells in another columns can't be sgrouped.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode
member.summary: Defines how columns are detected in the text.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.ContentGroupsAndBorders
member.summary: (0) Based on content groups and borders (vertical lines).

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.ContentGroups
member.summary: (1) Based on content groups only.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.Borders
member.summary: (2) Based on borders (vertical lines) only.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode.BorderedTables
member.summary: (3) Detects columns inside bordered tables only.

member.name: T:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRCacheMode
member.summary: OCR results caching behavior. Turned off by default (no cache is used). In "WholePage" caching mode you may save processing time as the SDK will check if need to re-run OCR on the page or can just pull results from previously cached OCR results.

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRCacheMode.Off
member.summary: no caching enabled

member.name: F:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRCacheMode.WholePage
member.summary: Whole page is cached. To use the cache extract with OCR from the whole page. And then read text data from regions inside page. Text will be taken from the cache for all regions inside the previous page wide region.

member.summary: Structured extraction (CSV, XML, XLS, StructuredExtractor, TextExtractor with PreserveFormatting = true) This option controls how much % of the cell's rectangle should intersect (by X coordinate axis) with previous cell to treat both cells belonging to the same column.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.RTLTextAutoDetectionEnabled
member.summary: Enables RTL (Right-To-Left) text auto detection.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractInvisibleText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract invisible text from PDF document.
member.value: true if extract invisible text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractShadowLikeText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to include characters used to create "shadow" effect (when the same character appears with some offset) from PDF document. True by default (includes all encoded characters disregarding their real appearance).
member.value: true if extract shadow like characters in text; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractAnnotations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text from annotation objects. Default is true.
member.value: true if extract annotations; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.Unwrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to unwrap lines into single lines or not (especially could be useful in the column layout mode - see ExtractColumnByColumn property). Default is False.
member.remarks: Unwrapping works only when the formatting keeping is disabled (PreserveFormattingOnTextExtraction property is set to False).
member.value: true if unwrap lines; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.RemoveHyphenation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automatically remove hyphenations in end of lines (works when Unwrap is True).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.AutoAlignColumnsToHeader
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to auto align text in columns while extracting text (with formatting preserved), csv, xml or not. True by default (i.e. align text in columns and header). False means to not auto align text and try to reproduce the original table.
member.value: true if try to auto align text in columns for text (with formatting), csv, xml, xls extraction. Set to false to provide more precise representation of the original table.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.PreserveFormattingOnTextExtraction
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to preserve the text formatting on the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.DetectLinesInsteadOfParagraphs
member.summary: Lines detection option. Obsolete: Use instead.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TrimSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to remove trailing and ending spaces from table cell values.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractColumnByColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to extract text column by column or use the visual layout of the text while extracting. False by default. if you are processing PDF newspapers with text columns, set this property to True so you get column by column instead of line by line
member.value: true if extract column by column; otherwise extracts line by line (default), false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.DetectNewColumnBySpacesRatio
member.summary: Space ratio between words.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRMode
member.summary:
Recognize text on embedded images using Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Set the language using OCRLanguage property.
This option requires Bytescout.PDFExtractor.OCRExtension.dll assembly and appropriate language files in OCRLanguageDataFolder folder. The SDK is shipped with for English, Franch, German and Spanish language files. You can download more at http://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr/downloads/list
member.remarks: Optical Character Recognition implemented with opensource Tesseract OCR engine: http://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.LineGroupingMode
member.summary: Sets how lines are grouped into paragraphs. Default: None (no lines grouping is performed).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ColumnDetectionMode
member.summary: Sets how columns are detected. Default: ContentGroupsAndBorders (columns are detected based on content groups and borders (vertical lines)).

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRCacheMode
member.summary: OCR results caching behaviour. Turned off by default (no cache is used). In "WholePage" caching mode you may save processing time as the SDK will check if need to re-run OCR on the page or can just pull results from previously cached OCR results.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRLanguageDataFolder
member.summary: Folder containing OCR language data files. The folder can be located anywhere by must be strongly named "tessdata".
member.remarks: By default the component expects "tessdata" in the folder containing the executing assembly.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRLanguage
member.summary:
Language for Optical Character Recognition (OCR). The valid values are: ValueLanguage
"eng"English (default)
"deu"German
"fra"French
"spa"Spanish
...See more languages at http://code.google.com/p/tesseract-ocr/downloads/list

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRResolution
member.summary: Resolution of Optical Character Recognition (OCR). Default is 300 DPI.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRAutoModeMinExistingTextLength
member.summary: Applies to OCRMode.Auto only: Min total length of existing text on current page to decide if OCR should be run or not. If the length of text is lesser than this property then library runs OCR for this page. Otherwise it extracts the existing text only.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRImagePreprocessingFilters
member.summary: Collection of image processing filters applied to the document page before Optical Character Recognition (OCR). May improve the recognition quality.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.TextEncodingCodePage
member.summary: Sets the default text encoding. Default encoding is Windows-1252.
member.remarks: You can find the full list of code pages at https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.text.encodinginfo.getencoding(v=vs.110).aspx

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.OCRDetectPageRotation
member.summary: Detect scanned page rotation.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontNames
member.summary: Consider font names in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontSizes
member.summary: Consider font sizes in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderFontColors
member.summary: Consider font colors in document text when detecting table structure. False by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ConsiderVerticalBorders
member.summary: Consider vertical borders colors in document text when detecting table structure and merging text objects. True by default.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.ExtractionColumns
member.summary: Contains columns detected from last processed document page.
member.value: Array of column coordinates.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.BaseTextExtractor.CustomExtractionColumns
member.summary: Allows to override the automatic columns detection with custom columns.
member.value: Array of column coordinates.
member.remarks: Example of use: If you have a document with the same column structure on all pages, you can run the extraction for the first page, take detected columns from it using property and pass them to CustomExtractionColumns. This will allow to avoid columns varying caused by minor changes in other pages structure and also speed up the extraction.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.ImageExtractor.ExtractRawImages
member.summary: Controls if we need to enable extraction of raw images (preserving the original dimensions of raw image saved inside PDF). True causes to extract images with their original dimensions. False casues to extract images rescaled according to scaling and skews defined for rendering (so image extractor provides images similar to what you see).

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.Find(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Searches the document page for specified text. Use .FoundText to read search result information (text elements found, location) Use .WordMatchingMode to change word matching mode used for the search. See also .WordMatchingPunctuationMarks to change punctuation marks treated as a part of word (dot, quotes etc).
member.returns: true if search string is found; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.FindNext
member.summary: Continues the text search started by Find() method. Use .FoundText to read search result information (text elements found, location) Use .WordMatchingMode to change word matching mode used for the search. See also .WordMatchingPunctuationMarks to change punctuation marks treated as a part of word (dot, quotes etc). Use .RegexSearch to enable regular expressions for the search.
member.returns: true if search string is found; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.FoundText
member.summary: Contains the bounding location (rectangle) of the text found by Find() or FindNext() methods. For more exact location please use .FoundSearchResult and its .FoundSearchResult.Elements[index]

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.RegexSearch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to search the text using regular expressions.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.WordMatchingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating word matching mode (used in text search and auto removal of hyphens). This option is ignored when regular expressions are enabled (via .RegexSearch to True). In case of regular expressions you should use \b metacharacter to specify word bounings.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.PageSeparator
member.summary: Gets or sets the page separator character or string. Default is '\f'.

member.name: P:Bytescout.PDFExtractor.TextExtractor.WordMatchingPunctuationMarks
member.summary: String containg chars treated as punctuation marks allowed inside words (and these punctuation marks are treated as a part of a word)
